alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Grainger; Jefferson; Knox; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 3:28AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Grainger, Jefferson, Knox and Union. * WHEN...Until 630 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 428 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Maynardville, Rutledge, Plainview, New Market, Blaine, Norris, Luttrell, Rose Hill, House Mountain State Park, Sharps Chapel, Joppa, Paulette, Big Ridge State Park, Norris Lake, Buffalo Springs, Andersonville and Norris Dam State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
